thread.title: Northern Lights filmed by airplane passenger over Canada | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Northern Lights filmed by airplane passenger over Canada | Daily Mail Online

author: Anna Hopkins For Dailymail.Com
title: Northern Lights filmed by airplane passenger over Canada | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Breathtaking footage of a geomagnetic storm was captured by an airplane passenger while flying east over Canada. Better known as 'northern lights', the storms create 'auroral currents', which create the glowing colorful lights sparkling in the horizon. The currents' reflection can be seen appearing much whiter over the bright city - and growing a deeper shade of emerald as the city lights fade. The currents' reflection can be seen appearing much whiter over the bright city - and growing a deeper shade of emerald as the city lights fade Better known as 'northern lights', the storms create 'auroral currents', which create the glowing colorful lights sparkling in the horizon The Space Weather Prediction center defines a geomagnetic storm as a 'major disturbance of Earth's magnetosphere.' They happen when there is a 'very efficient exchange of energy from the solar wind into the space environment surrounding Earth'. The ideal conditions to see the northern lights are generally in latitudes from 65 to 72 degrees between the months of November and March. Share or comment on this article 75
